title: Share a Data View
text:
Share a Data View
Data-Krauti has a built-in function that allows you to share a data view with others.
When you’ve loaded data from a publicly available data source, you can create a URL with the appropriate query parameters to easily reproduce the data view.
By clicking the share button, you will see the following dialog, where you will find both the long and short forms of the URL to share:


please note
You cannot share views of local data.

title: Why Data-Krauti ?
text:
Why Data-Krauti ?
Data-Krauti is for exploring data without having to install anything. It is inspired by mapshaper.org which gives everyone a tool to view and manipulate geographic data (.shp, geojson, topojson) n the browser.
Data-Krauti is also basic configuration tool for iXMaps visualization projects if the analyzed data holds geographic information. If you made a map with the data loaded, you can generate a HTML page with the JavaScript code to create the same map directly from data using the iXmaps embed API.

title: Welcome to Data-Krauti
text:
Welcome to Data-Krauti 
Data-Krauti is a free tool for exploring tabular data. It is based on HTML5 and operates directly in your browser without any additional installation. It can load both local and remote files in the formats CSV, JSON, GeoJSON, and TopoJSON. You can analyze and filter the data using several tools. If the data contains geographic information, a map can be activated to explore the data in its geographic context and relevance.



What Can I Do with Data-Krauti?
You can load and view data in table formats like CSV, JSON, GeoJson and TopoJson and

get a quick view on the table structure
see the first 100 rows of the data sort by table view by columns
filter the table data by column values (regular expression are possible)
generate data facets; one facet per column to understand the data and apply filters
get a quick data analysis with data type, min/max/sum or unique values and missing values

generate pivot tables
see the data on a map if geographic information is present in the data

Intended usage: Quick view and explore local and online data with a focus on data with geographic information. Create a basic iXMaps visualization from the data.
Works well for small and medium size data (approximate < 500 000 rows).


What Is It Not?
Data-Krauti is:

not a data editor
not a dashboard
not a notebook
no database query



Credits
Data-Krauti is open source and based on data.js to load and handle data.
It depends on the following JavaScript Libraries:

Papa Parse (https://www.papaparse.com/)
TopoJSON (https://github.com/topojson)
Bootstrap (https://getbootstrap.com/)
jQery (https://jquery.com/)

section: Now you can make the map yours!
text:
Now you can make the map yours!
At any time Data-Krauti can generate a HTML code with embedded iXMaps and a configuration to produce the map you have configured by the button ‘show embedding code (HTML)’

You cannot create a functioning HTML map if you loaded local data. But you can fix the data URL later in the HTML code
